skillTree.localised_description: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: " Let's Capture Some Slaves", while this Mount is equipped, for Dark Elf units on horses
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: " Let's Capture Some Slaves" for Dark Elf units on horses
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: " Now, now! Slaughter Them All", while this Mount is equipped, for Cold One units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: " Now, now! Slaughter Them All" for Cold One units
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: Magnificent chariots, gifted to those who have impressed with their devotion, bravery and prowess in battle.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Trample Them Under Our Wheels", while this Mount is equipped, for Chariot units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: "Trample Them Under Our Wheels" for Chariot units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: " Hunt Them Down", while this Mount is equipped, for Flying units except Dragons
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: " Hunt Them Down" for Flying units except Dragons
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: It is often the arrogant pursuit of their own unique enthusiasms and ambitions that distinguishes the noble-born from the low-born.
Those with darkest, most self-serving ambitions will always find a way to see them through to fruition.
Reaching any position of power is an indication of great strength in Druchii society, for they do not tolerate nor risk a weakling’s presence.
This one has adopted a warrior name to strike fear into enemy hearts, a moniker backed up by their deeds in battle.

effects.description: Choose a Name of Power that improves the Lord's own combat skills

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit: death.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 20
Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 35
Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 50

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit deals additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

backgroundSkills.localised_description: To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.
Evil-minded, poisonous malignancy. For its own sake.
When this one is abroad you can be sure that malice is borne towards anyone and everyone.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -40% for Cult of Khaine or Cult of Pleasure buildings
	(local region)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Death Hags
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Behind every thought they have - and every deed - is shameless, full-blooded spite.
"Some folk call me vicious. I'll scoop out the eyes of any who utter it in my presence."
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
